text: Days off a great! Hoping knowing you’re on ESET is helpful here?

Hi everyone.
Quick question about CLI. Maybe someone had this problem. After running `hs init` I get the next errors:
`[ERROR] A TypeError has occurred. Cannot read properties of null (reading 'replace')`
`[ERROR] A TypeError has occurred. Cannot destructure property 'accountId' of '(intermediate value)' as it is undefined.`
Did someone had this issue ? Maybe someone has a solution for this ?

Hi Buzco, could you share your version of `hs`?

`hs --version`
Everyone else here is BAU with the latest update from ESET it seams, alas not I, but I have been making a few changes to try and fix the issue. :-\

Thanks. We're taking a look at this internally but in the short term, can you see if you have the account name field populated in your Hub's settings? If not, try filling that in.

`<https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/><portal-id>/account-defaults/general`

<@UNHBK8QNM> yes :slightly_smiling_face: It was empty. Once I filled it in - everything works :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks very much for you hint !!!!
Very nice! Glad to help and :star: for you for helping us unearth this one. We'll get better error messaging on this in the future.
I saw some suggestions around setting node’s extra certificates environment variable, if you can navigate to and find where the ESET certificates come from.
Yes tried that but didn't work unfortunately... TBH I'm more a driver than a mechanic...
